Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_466909: Why application does not run from SCREEN without delay?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_466909: sh -cm

screen -d -m -L sh -cm 'nohup zenity --info --text test >&/dev/null & echo'

screen -d -m -L sh -cm 'zenity --info --text test >&/dev/null </dev/null & echo'

Explanations about Options.-m: Enable job control (default for interactive shells).
Explanations about Options.-c: Impose a size limit of n blocks on the size of core dumps.

Top-3 Scripts: so_42363207: mysql --user=test_user --password=xxxx  local_gw -sN -e 'UPDATE SER_MET SET VALUE='\''0 0 0 1 1 ? 2099'\'' WHERE `GROUP`= "TEST";commit'

Explanations about Options.-e:
Execute the statement and quit. The default output format is like that produced with
 --batch. See Section 4.2.2.1, “Using Options on the Command Line”, for some examples.
 With this option, mysql does not use the history file.
Explanations about Options.--user: The user name of the MySQL account to use for connecting to the server.
Explanations about Options.-s:
Silent mode. Produce less output. This option can be given multiple times to produce
 less and less output.
 This option results in nontabular output format and escaping of special characters.
 Escaping may be disabled by using raw mode; see the description for the --raw option.
Explanations about Options.-N: Do not write column names in results.
